translation:
Most Illustrious Sir Rodrigo Antônio da Silva, captain on duty.

By order I received from Sir Vicente Paulo de Oliveira Vilas Boas, I command Your Lordship Sir

Today the horses of Sir Pelúcio and all those who have gathered to be able to follow the column that for lack of horses has not proceeded to this point; Your Lordship

In your rear guard Your Lordship Lieutenant José Antônio should have the good horses that have been sent to him.

I warn Your Lordship Your Lordship

The delay of the column is awaiting these horses which, today, are following, and as soon as they arrive, it will set out for this point; this Your Lordship will also show to Sir Your Lordship Your Lordship

Nota Bene Your Lordship His Excellency

May God keep Your Lordship Passo do Mampituba, February 7, 1839. Paulo Pereira da Silva Alano, Sergeant Major in charge.
